summary: This is an email chain regarding a late travel voucher for a trip taken from September 17-20, 2019, to Santa Monica. The trip's purpose was listed as 'R19NYS13842 - U.S. v. Epstein - Witness Interviews,' indicating it was for federal prosecutors to conduct interviews related to the Jeffrey Epstein case.

events.title: Witness Interview Trip to Santa Monica
events.description: A trip was taken to Santa Monica for the purpose of conducting witness interviews for the case 'U.S. v. Epstein'.

keyFacts: The document is a travel voucher reminder email from October 1, 2019, related to a trip taken from September 17-20, 2019.
The trip's purpose was explicitly for 'R19NYS13842 - U.S. v. Epstein - Witness Interviews,' confirming active federal investigation activities after Epstein's 2019 arrest.
The travel was managed through the DOJ's E2Solutions system, indicating it was for Department of Justice personnel, likely federal prosecutors or investigators.
The destination was Santa Monica, California, suggesting witnesses or investigative leads were located there.
The email correspondence shows standard government travel reimbursement procedures being applied to a high-profile criminal investigation.
